title: [BUG] Nested runs not showing up on Firefox

labels.name: area/uiux
labels.description: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server

body:
### Willingness to contribute

No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### MLflow version

1.28.0

### System information

- **Ubuntu 20.04**:
- **Python 3.8.6**:

### Describe the problem

Nested runs don't have a drop down feature on Firefox but it works on Chrome. I tried clearing my cache on Firefox, but the issue was still present.

### Steps to reproduce the bug

Firefox 100.0.2 (64-bit)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43226539/189509376-dd9e97dc-f69f-47f1-b55b-f088bc450c4d.png)
vs
Chrome Version 105.0.5195.102 (Official Build) (64-bit)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43226539/189509393-a85b4975-ed41-4860-a743-ea6150d7dc2b.png)


### Code to generate data required to reproduce the bug

Slightly modified from https://towardsdatascience.com/5-tips-for-mlflow-experiment-tracking-c70ae117b03f to test a supposedly working example

```
import mlflow

mlflow.set_tracking_uri("http://localhost:5000")
experiment = mlflow.set_experiment(
        "test",
    )

with mlflow.start_run(experiment_id=experiment.experiment_id, run_name="top_lever_run") as run:
    with mlflow.start_run(experiment_id=experiment.experiment_id, run_name="subrun1",nested=True) as subrun1:
        mlflow.log_param("p1","red")
        mlflow.log_metric("m1", 5.1)
        with mlflow.start_run(experiment_id=experiment.experiment_id, run_name="subsubrun1",nested=True) as subsubrun1:
            mlflow.log_param("p3","green")
            mlflow.log_metric("m3", 5.24)
        with mlflow.start_run(experiment_id=experiment.experiment_id, run_name="subsubrun2", nested=True) as subsubrun2:
            mlflow.log_param("p4","blue")
            mlflow.log_metric("m5", 3.25)
    with mlflow.start_run(experiment_id=experiment.experiment_id, run_name="subrun2", nested=True) as subrun2:
        mlflow.log_param("p2","magenta")
        mlflow.log_metric("m2", -.25)
```

### Is the console panel in DevTools showing errors relevant to the bug?

Just some errors about the model registry b/c I haven't set it up and I'm just using my local file system for storage.
Firefox
[console-export-2022-9-10_22-37-59.txt](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/files/9541681/console-export-2022-9-10_22-37-59.txt)

Chrome
[localhost-1662863798076.log](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/files/9541682/localhost-1662863798076.log)


### Does the network panel in DevTools contain failed requests relevant to the bug?

No failed network requests in either Chrome nor Firefox
